alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 24 at 11:14AM EDT until March 29 at 8:00PM EDT by NWS Grand Rapids
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Grand Rapids MI has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Michigan... Maple River at Maple Rapids affecting Clinton County. .Recent rainfall of half an inch to one inch over the area has led to rises on the area rivers. Additional rainfall, and some snow, will be possible. However, it will remain on the lighter side. For the Maple River...including Maple Rapids...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM LATE TONIGHT TO TUESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River at Maple Rapids. * WHEN...From late tonight to Tuesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Expect minor flooding of County Line Road and a home along County Line Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 8.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage just after midnight tonight to a crest of 9.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.3 feet on 02/23/1951. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/grr. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon at 115 PM EDT.
